Establishing Process Rules

Establishing a system of process rules allows you to:

  • Require that process items be used every time files are added or checked into the  project.

  • Stipulate that only certain types of items with specific statuses can be used as process items in the project.

To set process rules, you must have the access rights required to change project properties. As a rule, only team leaders and administrators have these rights. You must also verify that project users have the rights to see and modify items in the project view and to create and modify links on files and process items.

To establish process rules:

  1. Select Project > Properties from the menu bar. The Project Properties dialog opens.

  2. Select the Process Rules tab.

  3. Select the Require selection of process items when files are added or checked in check box. To link to change requests, go to step 4. To link to requirements, go to step 5. To link to tasks go to step 6.

  4. To use change requests as process items.

    1. Select the Permit selection of change requests as process items check box.

    2. Specify what change requests will be available:

      • Select the Open check box to use only change requests with Open status as process items.

      • Select the In progress check box to use only change requests with In progress status as process items.

      • Select both the Open and In progress check boxes to use only change requests with either of these statuses as process items.

      • Clear both the Open and In progress check boxes to allow any change request to be used as a process item, regardless of status.

  5. To use requirements as process items:

    1. Select the Permit selection of requirements as process items check box.

    2. Specify what requirements will be available:

      • Select the Approved check box to use only requirements with Approved status as process items.

      • Clear the Approved check box to allow any requirement to be used as a process item, regardless of status.

  6. To use tasks as process items:

    1. Select the Permit Selection Of Tasks As Process Items check box.

    2. Specify what tasks will be available:

      • Select the Ready to start check box to use only tasks with Ready to start status as process items.

      • Select the In progress check box to use only tasks with In progress status as process items.

      • Select both the Ready to start and In progress check boxes to use only tasks with either of these statuses as process items.

      • Clear both the Ready to start and In progress check boxes to allow any task to be used as a process item, regardless of status.

    Note: Process rules apply to files added or checked in from the application and some application development environment integrations, such as the StarTeam SCC Integration, the StarTeam Delphi Integration, and the StarTeam Oracle Integration. Other StarTeam server clients, such as StarDisk, Web Edition, and other integrations, ignore process rules.
